Description: Solid-cast standing figure in copper alloy; half torso and head missing; both legs together and arms down by the sides, hands are held with palms and fingers stretched; vertical tang below small base; according to attitude, represents probably a female deity; corroded and surface rough.
Curator's comments: This figure does not hold any insignia of power and the arms are along the body. It does not appear to be a mummiform deity, but more a female goddess wearing a long dress. The high corrosion and fragmentary state of the figure does not allow further identification of the theme.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (MB.256) (phase 3)
